New Records: Mali secured their first qualification to the Africa Cup of Nations quarter-finals since 2013
Lassine Sinayoko scored the second goal for Mali within 133 seconds, one of the fastest goals in the tournament
Key Match Events: Edmond Tapsoba scored an own goal in the first half
Lassine Sinayoko doubled Mali's lead just after halftime
Bertrand Traore converted a penalty to reduce Burkina Faso's deficit
Issoufou Dayo's header was ruled offside after Burkina Faso thought they had scored
Pre-Game Insights: Mali made six changes from their previous lineup, including a new four-man midfield
Burkina Faso changed four players from their previous match, with Bertrand Traore as captain
Post-Match Reflections: Lassine Sinayoko expressed relief at the victory and acknowledged the challenges ahead
Mali's players celebrated the win but remained focused on their next match against Ivory Coast
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was Mali's second encounter with Burkina Faso in the Cup of Nations, with Mali winning 3-1 in 2004
The game was played in 36Â°C heat
